website_summaries.verdict: A bargain price and built-in DVD player distinguishes the Linksys DMA2200 from rival Windows Media Center Extenders, but we found the performance to be inconsistent.
pros: Windows Media Center Extender with built-in upscaling DVD player
cons: incompatibility issues with various movie file formats
only streams from Media Center-compatible PCs

customer_reviews.title: Good but not Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I linked my HP Media Center Computer to my large screen TV which is about 40 feet away in another room. The system is linked using a Linksys WRT160N router. The picture and sound are good but there is some break-up of the picture at times. I am now recording television at a higher quality setting and this seems to help. The only problem I had with installation was getting the extender to stay linked. I am using NORTON Internet Security and this seemed to be the problem. Once I added the extender to the "trusted" list the linking problem disapeared. Overall, I am pleased with my purchase and would buy the extender again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill in Tucson

customer_reviews.title: Works great as an extender and DVD drive.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this through the Amazon marketplace used. It worked great when I got it and the kids love it. The menu systems aren't as fluid as my XBOX 360 but it is tolerable. I was glad this still has composite out so I could connect it to an old CRT TV and still be able to use it when I upgrade the TV to a flat screen. The wireless works great, I tested but don't use it because I have a physical cable run to this box. UPDATE: This is still going strong. No complaints. Even connected to an old LCD and new Windows 7 computer since I wrote this review.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Linksys Media Center Extender
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Linksys Media Center Extender to compliment the Samsung LN650A LCD TV I purchased. Setup was easy enough. DVD works great for movies. Downside is I wished there was more information out there on how to setup movies and storage. It would also be nice to figure out how to incorporate the Samsung remote to work with the extender or the extender remote to work with the Samsung TV. I am sure it is all possible I just havent found the "how to" information yet... It is also great for displaying pictures from the laptop wirelessly through the media center to the Samsung TV.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Media Center Extender
customer_reviews.text: I was shopping for a media center extender to hook up to my HDTV - found this and for the price it was a steal. I had no problems getting it installed and working. Now I can watch whatever I have on my PC on my TV in HD. You have to make sure you have the right type of router to use with it. Just do some research like I did and you will not have any problems. But don't think it is just plug and play unless you have the router to support it. For me it does what I wanted it to do - provided you have the the other pieces that it needs to work with.
customer_reviews.author: CharleK

customer_reviews.title: Coul have more functions
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, bur I actually was looking for some device capable to navigate trough the Internet on my TV. I thought that I could see on my TV what was going on my PC. Another problem is that you need to buy a very expensive router to make it work properly. For the moment I have a Router G, and when somebody turns on a microwave, I loose the connection with my PC, and then need to restart everything. I'd like it to have a keyboard, a web browser, and to be more customizable.
customer_reviews.author: Juan A De LLano

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This extender was very inexpensive, easy to setup and easy to use. Highly recommended. The only negative is that there are some video formats that it will not play but ANY type of converter you could possibly need is available online.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn Seavey

customer_reviews.title: disappointment product
customer_reviews.text: Actually not sure if the problem is this extender or the N router, or the usb N NIC all from Linksys, the thing is that this extender disconnects continuously from the network, or from the windows media center, I need to keep reconnecting this device, I can't see a movie peacefully, I believe that Linksys really sucks!! I'm about to buy a Western Digital WD TV HD Media Player, I'm sure this one won't fail. But Linksys, NO MORE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: rbreedy

customer_reviews.title: No Live TV support
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is it does not support live tv playback, at least with my Ceton Eth6.
customer_reviews.author: William D Powers

customer_reviews.title: DMA 2200
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy enough. Pictures and some videos work fine. The DMA 2200 only works with Windows Media Center, so watching internet tv is very limited. If your apps. don't integrate with WMC, (Hulu is one exammple.) Then the app. won't work with the DMA 2200. I wish I would have known this. I didn't find that fact in any of the product descriptions. If I could return it for a full refund, I would. No wonder there are so many of these on eBay!
customer_reviews.author: John W. Drong

customer_reviews.title: The headaches continue
customer_reviews.text: I have never bought a product that requires so much effort with technical support. While the tech people do their job, I spend 3 hours trying to get set up wirelessly and finally she said "you need to check with your router's tech support as I can't help you anymore". So I spend $20 more to get CAT6 cable and then spent 3 more hours after which he told me "you need to contact Microsoft if you are having more problems". I can get it to work sporatically and it is cool when it does, but unless you are very technical and have several hours to kill, I would recommend against this as a purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy W. Boggess

customer_reviews.title: Not Ready for Prime Time
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Linksys Media Center Extender with high hopes it would complete my home theatre. After many hours on line with Linksys tech support I reluctantly returned the item to Amazon. I could not get the Linksys MCE to work with my HP laptop running on 64bit Vista Ultimate. I even used two different draft N routers to no avail. On the positive side, I found Linksys Tech Support to be readily available and very patient with my having to reboot and re-enter my WPA passphrase numerous time. I will continue to look for an MCE that has Hi-Def capability.
customer_reviews.author: J. Whelan

customer_reviews.title: Happy with our Extenders
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of these extenders in our home using a wired connection. They have been wonderful for watching downloaded programs and the DVD players are region free which is an added bonus! They do freeze up sometimes, but just restart and they are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Maple Girl

customer_reviews.title: superb!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful stuff... Why do you pay an expensive price for any XBOX ... if this extender do the same thing???
customer_reviews.author: i_mm store

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR $$$$'s
customer_reviews.text: Be warned this device does not work well with Windows 7, I have spent hours trying to connect this and longer waiting for help from Lynsys support. Basic DVD functions work but that is it
customer_reviews.author: Steven John Davis

customer_reviews.title: It play good, and i ok with it
customer_reviews.text: It was 2300 when i want 2200, That could been my mistate. It play good, and i ok with it.
customer_reviews.author: donald bunn

customer_reviews.title: It is a good idea, but poorly implemented
customer_reviews.text: the product is not good, doesn't have current firmware updates, and don't let you use all functions from your windows media center. So don't buy it!!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Orosz

customer_reviews.title: working best with dual band WRT600N wireless
customer_reviews.text: No more networking issue when it is paired with the dual band WRT600N. It has been working solidly without dropping and connected evertime when the Vista Media PC is on. I have set up the WRT600N (using WPA2 AES) with 5GHz for media only and the 2.4GHz for non-media traffic like internet and other networking. It is designed for wireless use. If it only works well with ethernet cable, I will not be satisfied at all. The only complaint that I have is the not so-fast remote control response, but I am realistic for the fact that remote plus remote equals slow.
customer_reviews.author: WaltAmaz

customer_reviews.title: Buggy beyond belief!
customer_reviews.text: I could *only* get it to work on the wireless N. Then, it drops the connection with the PC about every twenty minutes even though signal strength is above 90% and there's no other traffic or interferance. Each time it drops, you have to reconfigure it, which for me means running up and down the stairs with the eight digit "code" to reconfigure it. This product is a total waste of money! Shame on Linksys!
customer_reviews.author: J. Trumps

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying this Extender very much. My only complaints are not with the extender, but with Microsoft. I have a Vista Media PC and a Windows Home Server. Getting Vista and WHS to work together is a total pain. Unfortunatly the Linksys Extender is at the mercy of the Microsoft Software. After hours of painfull configuration and security adjustments, the extender has performed exactly as desired.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN N WALKER

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but weak DVD player
customer_reviews.text: We like the idea of combining both these two functions - DVD player and media extender. The extender seems to be working alright, but we have trouble with the DVD player not recognizing DVDs or taking forever to read it. Thinking of going back to my old DVD player, which is a shame.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gant

customer_reviews.title: The value extender
customer_reviews.text: The unit works well and is silent, which is a great advantage over the xbox when used as an extender. The price is right! on the downside, the menus are not as snappy as a Media center PC, or the xbox 360 - not deal breaker slow, but could be better.
customer_reviews.author: FogCityBrit

customer_reviews.title: Linksys DMA-2200
customer_reviews.text: Incredible value!!! Not only does it cost less than the D-Link Media Center Extender, but it also comes with an upconverting DVD player. All for $139. My only complaint is that when you initially turn it on it takes almost a minute to fully boot up. But other than that, it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Nemerofsky

customer_reviews.title: GREAT UNIT! For the price.
customer_reviews.text: If you are on a budget, get this. You can't go wrong. I have one and love it. Linksys is a TOP GUN in the medis business. Don't be left behind in the media age. R.E.J.
customer_reviews.author: Randy E. Jackson Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Hassle
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to finally get this product home. I had been looking for purchase it for a while but could not find a good excuse for it. Now that I tried it, I am going back to my old setup. I am buying a inexpensive HP Slim computer and placing it inside the glass doors of our entertainment center. Wait maybe 5 years and they may have this figure out by then but for now avoid the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This little box connected easily to my media workstation two floors away. Picture is good and the system works as advertised. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Steven Keller

product_meta.title: Cisco-Linksys Media Center Extender with DVD
product_meta.description:
Sharing your photos, music and movies on your computer with friends and family has been made easy by the DMA 2200 Media Center Extender from Linksys. The device allows you to view digital photos, movies and high definition programs on your TV, and listen to downloaded music on your home theater sound system. It even enables accessing digital content and Internet services from your Microsoft Windows Vista Premium or Ultimate Media Center PC and wirelessly stream it to your home entertainment system. Its single learning remote helps you to easily navigate menus. The media extender uses existing high-speed Wireless-N home network and includes built-in upscaling DVD player.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER




Access movies, your music library, family photos and HDTV programming from your Media Center PC and stream it all to your living room TV or home theater. New Linksys Media Center Extenders give you access to the entertainment content on your Microsoft Windows Vista Premium or Ultimate PC to enjoy in the comfort of your living room. Pause or rewind live TV, record sporting events or episodes of your favorite TV shows and save them for later viewing. Quickly navigate through elegant menus and programming guides. Access online movie, music and other Internet services to expand your entertainment options. 

The Linksys DMA2200 integrates the latest in 1080i upscaling DVD players with Windows Media Center and streams your digital music, movies and photos to any TV in your home without running wires. With elegant and easy-to-navigate menu screens, you can play DVDs, view family slide shows, browse your music collection by cover art, listen to entire playlists or choose from a vast selection of Internet Radio stations from all over the world. 

The Linksys Media Center Extender and your Windows Vista Media Center PC give you a complete PVR solution--allowing you to watch, pause, rewind and record live TV (PC-embedded or optional TV tuner required). In addition to traditional TV, you also have access to a broad set of popular Internet video services that enable you to download the latest movie releases or stream the latest releases from Showtime, Fox Sports, Nickelodeon, and more. 

Leveraging the robust bandwidth capacity of dual-band Wireless-N, the DMA2200 has been engineered to quickly stream rich, high-definition content directly from your Media Center PC to your HDTV and surround-sound system. Let the Linksys DMA2200 bring your digital media collection out into the living room for the whole family to enjoy.
